unnormalised: **Social Media & Influencer Marketing: Follower Analytics Getting a Desi Makeover!**
normalised: Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Follower Analytics Getting a Desi Makeover!

unnormalised: Mumbai: Forget the gora insights, folks! Local startups are finally giving follower analytics a desi twist. Think beyond basic engagement metrics. We're talking about sentiment analysis that understands Hinglish slang and trending chai debates!
normalised: Mumbai: Forget the gora insights, folks! Local startups are finally giving follower analytics a desi twist. Think beyond basic engagement metrics. We are talking about sentiment analysis that understands Hinglish slang and trending chai debates!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIT-Delhi's marketing dept. says, "These tools are a game-changer for understanding the Indian audience." Imagine knowing if your #Diwali post resonated more with Gen Z in Delhi versus Boomers in Chennai.
normalised: Doctor Sharma from I I T hyphen Delhi's marketing department says, "These tools are a game changer for understanding the Indian audience." Imagine knowing if your hash Diwali post resonated more with Gen Z in Delhi versus Boomers in Chennai.

unnormalised: One promising platform, "AnalyseIndia," even claims to track fake followers down to the sq ft of their possible location – suspiciously close to some notorious influencer farms.
normalised: One promising platform, "AnalyseIndia," even claims to track fake followers down to the square foot of their possible location – suspiciously close to some notorious influencer farms.

unnormalised: Brands are already seeing results. A recent campaign by "Gulab Jamun Delight" saw a 20% jump in engagement after tweaking their content based on AnalyseIndia's insights. They even factored in the average commute time (in km!) for their target demographic, leading to better ad placements.
normalised: Brands are already seeing results. A recent campaign by "Gulab Jamun Delight" saw a twenty percent jump in engagement after tweaking their content based on AnalyseIndia's insights. They even factored in the average commute time (in kilometer!) for their target demographic, leading to better ad placements.

unnormalised: Early estimates suggest the market for desi follower analytics could be worth Rs. 500 Cr. in the next 2 years. Time to ditch the generic reports and embrace the Bharat perspective!
normalised: Early estimates suggest the market for desi follower analytics could be worth rupee five hundred crore in the next two years. Time to ditch the generic reports and embrace the Bharat perspective!
